page.title: 11CAR ACCIDENT TRANSPORT
page.content: WE INTERVIEWED THELMA WINDER OF GREENSIDE ABOUT HER ACCIDENT WHICH HAPPENED ON FRIDAY 16 SEPTEMBER 1983 AT 3.30 P.M. SHE SAID "IT WAS LIKE A DREAM"SHE WAS DRIVING ALONG AT THE TOP OF ASH FELL SEDBERGH TURN OFF AND THE ROAD WAS VERY WET AND SLIPPERY. AS SHE CAME AROUND THE CORNER SHE LOST CONTROL. THEN SHE THOUGHT SHE HAD CONTROL BUT SHE HAD NOT AND SHE WENT RIGHT ACROSS THE ROAD, IN FRONT OF ANOTHER CAR AND INTO THE WALL. BEFORE SHE HIT THE WALL SHE BLACKED OUT. A MAN FROM SUNDERLAND WAS BE HIND HER AND RESCUED HER. SHE WAS UNCONSCIOUS AND THERE WERE FLAMES COMING UP THROUGH THE FLOOR. HE BROKE INTO THE CAR TO GET HER OUT. HIS WALLET FELL IN FLAMES. THE MAN WHO RESCUED THELMA GOT A BRAVERY CERTIFICATE BECAUSE OF WHAT HE DID.
